settings.heroimage_paragraph_text: Crisp lines. Vibrant blocks of colour. A slightly raised, tactile feel you can actually run your fingers across. When you want bold graphics, high colour contrast, and a finish that’ll last the distance, this is your go-to.

settings.content_paragraph_text: Your artwork is converted to a high-contrast, black-and-white image and printed onto a transparent acetate film. This film acts like a stencil template or blueprint that guides the entire print process.

Next, we prep the mesh screen (basically a tightly-woven fabric stretched over a frame) by coating it with a light-sensitive emulsion. This emulsion reacts to light. When we place your film over it then expose it to light, the design blocks part of the light, creating a stencil as we wash away the unhardened areas.
Once the screen’s dry and mounted, we lay your garment on the press. Ink gets pulled across the stencil with a squeegee, printing your design right onto the fabric. One colour = one screen.
Fresh prints head straight into the dryer. The heat cures the ink, locking in colour and durability so your designs hold strong wash after wash.
Before anything leaves the floor, our crew gives it a final once-over. Alignment, ink coverage, finish – every detail is checked to make sure it’s on point.

settings.cta_paragraph_text: We’ve screen-printed everything from 20-unit runs for cult indie brands to 20,000-unit campaigns for global powerhouses. If bold, scalable merch is what you’re after – screen printing is your ride or die.

settings.bento_paragraph_text: We’ve perfected the screen printing process through decades of high-stakes, high-volume runs. Every press stroke. Every layer. Every dry cycle. Engineered for durability. Tuned for serious impact.
